title: Eleven arrested in probe over far-right activist's death, with far-left group under scrutiny
subhead: Several suspects had been flagged as national security threats due to their ties with the antifascist group Jeune Garde. Two of them worked for MP Raphaël Arnault, the founder of Jeune Garde and member of the hard-left party La France Insoumise.

title: Epstein scandal divides the MAGA world and weakens Trump
'The spectacle of European disunity in the face of pressure from both the United States and China is infuriating'
Teens on France's social media ban for under-15s: 'We're going back to the Stone Age'
subhead: The measure to ban social media for those under age 15 would affect mostly middle schoolers. About a dozen of them shared their concerns with Le Monde about a law set to upend their online lives.

title: Kyiv's fourth winter at war has spared no one
subhead: In the freezing Ukrainian capital, residents are regularly without heat and electricity. People get by through resourcefulness and solidarity, living with a sense of inevitability.

title: Snow camping at ski resorts: 'Our friends think we're crazy'
subhead: Although many have disappeared, 'caravaneige' campsites – those that welcome campers and caravans in the snow – are still enjoying good times at high altitudes, driven by a new generation of skiing campers and their unbeatable prices.

title: Némésis, the identitarian activists behind feminist masks
subhead: Named for the Greek goddess of retribution, the French group specializes in provocative protests and perpetually blames immigrants and Muslims for sexual violence. Since its creation in 2019, members have regularly infiltrated left-wing protests to shout their own slogans.

title: Merz says Germany does not need same fighter jets as France
Macron and Modi seek a 'no-boundaries' partnership
US envoy Witkoff says 'meaningful progress' made in Ukraine war talks
Peru's Congress impeaches interim President Jose Jeri
Iran and US agree on 'guiding principles' for a deal, say Iranian officials
ICC judge hit by US sanctions urges EU to step in

Mexico seeks to bring its archaeological treasures back from France
Chinese kung-fu robots steal the show in world's most-watched TV program

French interior minister eases tensions with Algeria by reviving 'security cooperation'
In substance, Rubio's message in Munich was the same as Vance's
subhead: While the US secretary of state struck a less aggressive tone toward Europe than the American vice president had a year earlier, the substance of the speech changed little.

title: How Jeffrey Epstein built the global network that protected him
subhead: The sexual predator, who came from a modest background, used his scheming and manipulation to open the doors to the global elite. His influence was such that many powerful figures continued to associate with him, even after his first conviction in 2008.

title: Who owns second homes in France?
subhead: Owners of second homes are not a homogeneous group. They include retirees, professionals and investors, reflecting changing ways of living and challenging the organization of local communities.

title: Rejecting political violence
'By sacrificing American soft power, Trump is exacerbating his country's unpopularity and prompting Europeans to exercise their own'
'Donald Trump floods the political and media landscape, even in France, where domestic issues suddenly seem trivial'
